name: places/ChIJ6XfAWfpYwokRSYtrb90STFo
adrFormatAddress: 711 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022-3114, USA

originalText.text: There's been something wrong with the 2lt Coca-Cola, as soon it gets open it sounds flat, and the taste as well. I've have try it in different supermarket, stores and is the same. But it only works with the 2lt, not with the can. But since I buy the big one and not the can, please fix it. Put it as it was way before, with the bubbles and the great taste and not as if you're drinking water.

originalText.text: To be honest, the company is terrible, and drinks are new history, and I doubt that

originalText.text:
My daughter and I just walked into the Coca Cola building because of the beautiful art and posters that grace the hallway. We were treated very rudely for just entering the space.

If I were coke, I’d either lock the doors, remove the art or hire friendlier people. The curmudgeon behind the desk offended my daughter.

I guess I know what the real thing means now.

I guess I know what the real thing means now.

originalText.text: Well, I saw the Coca-Cola office only from the outside, however this does bring back that beautiful sense of nostalgia! I found myself humming "I'd like to teach the world to sing" Another wonderful all America tourist attraction in the heart of Manhattan!

text.text: Well, I saw the Coca-Cola office only from the outside, however this does bring back that beautiful sense of nostalgia! I found myself humming "I'd like to teach the world to sing" Another wonderful all America tourist attraction in the heart of Manhattan!

originalText.text:
Horrible. Was walking by with my family today while on our touristic journey to NYC. Being a HUGE fan of cocacola (i think cola runs in my veins instead of blood, no joke;),naturaly i got super excited and walked in to see the awesome pictures in the lobby. We were all in great mood just coming back from Central Park. The receptionist at the desk told us that the building was offices only and is closed for public. I asked if we could look at the posters around us. I was SHOCKED what happened next. The reseptionist said in a very rude voice “Which part of closed for public I didnt understand?”. I said respectfuly:” SIR! I understood that the building is closed.” (Keep in mind that the lobby is a narrow coridor separating entrance from the receptionist desk and elevators and its 10 METERS; so the receptionist doesnt sit by the entrance, and to my understanding its perfectly normal to come in and have a look, since the doors are not locked, there is no buzzer or a sign that its closed for public viewing). I said “I was just wondering if we could look at the posters here by the door.” And the receptionist got extremely rude replying to me raising his voice at me:” Which part of this sentance dont you understand?! I told you three times already!”
I was in shock. We left wishing that person to learn some manners. Should i even tell you that he stood up behind his desk and started screaming offensive things at me as i was walking out....Im extremely dissapointed because i defend cocacola to everyone. If thats the people they choose to work with, $&@$ it!, i’ll switch to Pepsi!
What a let down. Mood was ruined.
